
prep-plenv-perl-version
-----------------------

Used to compile a version of Perl for plenv.  This script can only compile
with default options, as it does not have any concept of command line options.

    ./prep-plenv-perl-version <version>

If special compilation options are needed, do it by hand:

    sudo -i
    plenv install <version> --as=<version-name> <build-options>
    plenv shell <version-name>
    plenv install-cpanm
    plenv exec cpanm Readonly Moose JSON::XS Log::Log4perl File::Slurp Carton
    exit

We've done this with version=5.18.2, version-name=5.18.2-threads,
build-options=-Dusethreads.

create-plenv-perl-package
-------------------------

Used to package a version of Perl for plenv.  This cannot be run in the
~vagrant/sources/plenv directory, as it needs to make symlinks, so run it
from a different directory:

    cd ~
    mkdir plenv
    cd plenv
    ln -s ../sources/plenv/* .
    ./debian/tools/create-plenv-perl-package <version>

This script does not understand anything but straight versions, so if
packaging a specially named version (like 5.18.2-threads), run the script,
then rename the appropriate .orig.tar.gz file, then run the script again:

    ./debian/tools/create-plenv-perl-package <version-name>
    mv plenv-perl-<version-name>_{<version-name>,<version>}.orig.tar.gz
    ./debian/tools/create-plenv-perl-package <version-name>
